column2:
COVID-19 negative certification required for entering the country. 

Unvaccinated travelers are required to provide a negative PCR test taken 72 hours prior to departure. Fully vaccinated travelers are exempt from pre-departure testing requirements. Non-vaccinated or partially vaccinated passengers arriving from the UK will require a negative PCR COVID-19 certificate, taken no more than 72 hours before arrival. Passengers will also be asked to submit to a Rapid Diagnostic Test. If found positive, you will be quarantined at a government facility until your test returns a negative result.
column3:
Quarantine requirement at government designated site- subject to PCR. Fully vaccinated passengers arriving from the UK do not require a negative PCR COVID-19 test to enter The Gambia. However, if you display signs or symptoms of COVID-19 at the border you will be asked to submit to a Rapid Diagnostic Test. If found positive, you will be quarantined at a government facility until your test returns a negative result.
If you are non-vaccinated or partially vaccinated, you must present a negative PCR COVID-19 test taken no more than 72 hours before you arrive in The Gambia to Ministry of Health officials. A positive test on arrival will result in you being tested and quarantined for 14 days at your own cost.
column5:
Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*Entry to The Gambia: Commercial flights to and from The Gambia remain very limited. Check with your travel company for the latest information. The land border with Senegal is open.
Fully vaccinated passengers arriving from the UK do not require a negative PCR COVID-19 test to enter The Gambia. However, if you display signs or symptoms of COVID-19 at the border you will be asked to submit to a Rapid Diagnostic Test. If found positive, you will be quarantined at a government facility until your test returns a negative result.
Non-vaccinated or partially vaccinated passengers arriving from the UK will require a negative PCR COVID-19 certificate, taken no more than 72 hours before arrival. Passengers will also be asked to submit to a Rapid Diagnostic Test. If found positive, you will be quarantined at a government facility until your test returns a negative result. Infants below 2 years of age are exempt. All other passengers must show proof of full vaccination or a negative PCR COVID-19 certificate.
*Demonstrating your COVID-19 status: The Gambia will accept the proof of COVID-19 recovery and vaccination record. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*Quarantine requirements: If you are non-vaccinated or partially vaccinated, you must present a negative PCR COVID-19 test taken no more than 72 hours before you arrive in The Gambia to Ministry of Health officials. A positive test on arrival will result in you being tested and quarantined for 14 days at your own cost.
*Screening on arrival: Additional surveillance and detection mechanisms have been put in place at Banjul International Airport and various points of entry along The Gambia’s border.


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in The Gambia: Commercial flights to and from The Gambia remain very limited. Check with your travel company for the latest information. The land border with Senegal is open. Additional surveillance and detection mechanisms have been put in place at Banjul International Airport and various points of entry along The Gambia’s border.
*Public places and services: All facilities in The Gambia are open.
Social distancing measures should be applied. You should check with the local authorities on the current restrictions.
If you test positive for COVID-19 and are asymptomatic you will be expected to self-isolate. Self-isolating at your hotel will be at your own cost. If you develop symptoms you should call 1025. Depending on the severity of your symptoms, you may be asked to attend a medical facility.
You will be contacted if you test positive for COVID-19. If placed in isolation, there is limited assistance offered. You should have contact details for people that can bring you food and bedding. You will be required to isolate until you receive a negative test result.
*If you test positive for COVID-19 and are asymptomatic you will be expected to self-isolate. Self-isolating at your hotel will be at your own cost. If you develop symptoms you should call 1025. Depending on the severity of your symptoms, you may be asked to attend a medical facility.
You will be contacted if you test positive for COVID-19. If placed in isolation, there is limited assistance offered. You should have contact details for people that can bring you food and bedding. You will be required to isolate until you receive a negative test result.
Children under 2 years old are exempt.
